title: Tiger Bath
description: Clay, Daniel, and Enzo gather at a pool at the Wild Animal Sanctuary in Keenesburg, Colorado. They're three of 39 tigers rescued from an animal park in Oklahoma. Here, they will live out their lives with proper nutrition and vet care.

title: Sunset Frolic
description: A young Thomson's gazelle leaps across the plains of Kenya's Maasai Mara at sunset. Thomson's gazelles are one of the world's fastest land animals, able to hit speeds of 55 miles per hour. They need to be fast: they're a favorite prey of cheetahs.

title: Sunset Frolic

title: Spanish Flock
description: Goatherders tend to their flock in Asturias, Spain. The region calls itself the "pais de quesos" (land of cheese) due to the dozens of artisanal varieties it produces, including a famous goat cheese called cabrales. This photo appears in the December/ January issue of Traveler Magazine.

title: Ancient Practice
description: A Buddhist monk practices a puja, or Buddhist devotion, in the city of Mustang, Nepal. 700 years ago, Mustang was a bustling kingdom and a center of Buddhist scholarship and art.

title: Ancient Practice
description: A Buddhist monk practices a puja, or Buddhist devotion, in the city of Mustang, Nepal. 700 years ago, Mustang was a bustling kingdom and a center of Buddhist scholarship and art.

title: Off Route 66
description: Two donkeys are captured resting in the shade off the road in Oatman, Arizona—a historic town that is located along the iconic Route 66, which is also known as the "Main Street of America."

title: Off Route 66
description: Two donkeys are captured resting in the shade off the road in Oatman, Arizona—a historic town that is located along the iconic Route 66, which is also known as the "Main Street of America."

title: Giant Kelp Forests
description: In Argentina's remote Tierra del Fuego, the giant kelp forests of Thetis Bay harbor one of the most magnificent marine ecosystems on the planet. The future is bright for the abundance of life that calls the habitat home, thanks to the recent creation of the Yaganes Marine Protected Area by the Argentine government.

title: Giant Kelp Forests
description: In Argentina's remote Tierra del Fuego, the giant kelp forests of Thetis Bay harbor one of the most magnificent marine ecosystems on the planet. title: Flooding in Ohio
description: This year has been a historic season for flooding throughout the Great Lakes region of North America—primarily due to heavy snowmelt pouring into the lakes, which was followed by a prolonged rain season. Port Clinton, a summer destination for vacationers in Ohio, was affected by the flooding that seriously damaged businesses and homes.

title: Vibrant Pier
description: Crowds gather to enjoy an evening full of food, games and rides at the Race Street Pier in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The colorful pier is located near the bustling Central Delaware Waterfront, near the heart of downtown.

title: Vibrant Pier
description: Crowds gather to enjoy an evening full of food, games and rides at the Race Street Pier in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The colorful pier is located near the bustling Central Delaware Waterfront, near the heart of downtown.

title: Ornate Masterpiece
description: The Casa Professa—or Church of the Gesù—is one of the most important masterpieces of Baroque art in Sicily, Italy. It is enhanced by incredible decorations in marble and stucco, which according to American art historian Donald Garstang, “belong to the world of unleashed fancy.” The tireless work, spanning over 200 years by some of the most accomplished artists in the world, is on display everywhere you look in sculptures, polychrome inlays, stucco art, frescoes, and ornate marble construction.

title: Warming Up
description: Members of the Battambang Roses Women's Wheelchair basketball team practice at the Regional Physical Rehabilitation Center where they train in Battambang, Cambodia. The team was created in 2012, with members recruited from the surrounding area.

title: Warming Up

title: Car-Free City
description: In Colombia's capital city of Bogotá, a little over 75 miles of roadway are turned over each Sunday to the Ciclovía—a weekly affair where cars are banned from the streets—and as many as one-and-a-half million Bogotanos come out to bike or ride.

title: Car-Free City

title: Basque Culture in Idaho
description: Thousands of sheep parade through downtown Ketchum, Idaho, during the Trailing of the Sheep Festival, which takes place annually in October. The state is home to a thriving Basque community in America.

title: Basque Culture in Idaho

title: Palm Springs Party
description: Every year, Tiki enthusiasts and collectors take over Palm Springs’ Caliente Tropics Resort for the weekend to immerse themselves in an sensory-driven, escapist world that celebrates the music, art, clothing and cocktails of Tiki culture.

title: Winter in Mongolia
description: Ulaanbaatar has grown rapidly and in an unplanned way in recent years, as nomadic herders have left the countryside and settled on the city's outskirts, in districts such as Dari Ekh. Living in gers or simple houses, they use coal stoves for both heating and cooking.
